ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend this class to people who had previously had some contact with the field.
I would definitely recommend the course to anyone who is interested in the study of sound.
Definitely. If one is interested in exploring sound in any field, be it art history, film, cultural studies, one should take this course.
It's a class on steroids, both exciting and exacting.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: While not immediately relevant to my key interests, the course offered an opportunity to become involved in one of the hottest areas of scholarship in my field, and should therefore prove useful going forward.
It got me very much interested in sound in relation to cinema.

This was the aspect about the course I found most helpful. Professor Connor assigned a large amount reading so that we could see not just what arguments are made but how they are constructed. He always urged us to see the bigger picture.We reflected regularly as a group on what is expected of us in our profession: how to write a high-stakes paper, different ways to approach academic writing, and how to structure an argument. Professor Connor's honesty and personal high standards (when not slightly daunting) were very inspiring.
